cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles E of Wilmington North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW, expected to turn west then west-southwest into extreme eastern South Carolina on Saturday, then curve northward across the western Carolinas and Appalachians

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Santee River SC northward to Duck NC, including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (76% chance of ≥34 kt, 25% chance of ≥50 kt) with occasional hurricane-force gusts possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the Charleston Harbor and adjacent coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 15 inches could cause flash and river flooding in the Charleston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor tornado risk as outer rainbands sweep inland.
